required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Feasibility of the Zotarolimus Stent in Treating Males With Erectile Dysfunction (ED)
clinical_study.official_title: The Medtronic Zotarolimus-Eluting Peripheral Stent System for the Treatment of Erectile Dysfunction in Males With Sub-optimal Response to PDE5 Inhibitors

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety and feasibility of the Medtronic Zotarolimus stent to improve erectile function in males with sub-optimal response to PDE5i therapy due to atherosclerotic lesions of the internal iliac and/or internal pudendal arteries.

detailed_description.textblock: Stenting of the internal iliac and/or internal pudendal arteries as a treatment means to improve sexual performance.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor chose not to pursue indication for erectile dysfunction

primary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Event (MAE) rate at 30 days
primary_outcome.description: MAE defined as: device and/or procedure related death, occurrence of perineal gangrene or necrosis (penile glans, penile shaft, scrotal or anal), perineal, penile or anal surgery (including target lesion or vessel revascularization or arterial embolization procedures).
An improvement from pre-procedure in erectile function at 3 months as assessed by the erectile function domain score (Questions 1 - 5 and 15) of the International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF).

secondary_outcome.description: MAE rate measured at the 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 month timepoints.
Changes in sexual function from pre-procedure as assessed by the IIEF at 30 days, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48 and 60 months

Changes in sexual function as assessed by the Sexual Encounter Profile (SEP) diary responses (SEP2 and SEP3) from baseline and measured as a percentage of successful attempts while on optimal PDE5i at 30 days, 3, 6, and 12 months

Mean peak systolic velocity (PSV) as assessed by duplex ultrasound (DUS) in the right and left cavernosal arteries at the mid-shaft during pharmacologically induced erection within 30 days and 6 and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Restenosis of the artery and integrity of the stent
secondary_outcome.description: Restenosis and stent integrity as assessed by angiogram at 6 months
Penile rigidity as assessed by RigiScan at 6 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At time of deployment to time of hospital discharge, an expected average of 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Device, lesion, and procedure success rates

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline through 30 days and 3, 6, and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Claudication by vascular territory as assessed by change in Rutherford class by greater than or equal to 1 category from baseline at 30 days and 3, 6, and 12 months

intervention.description: Various lengths and diameters of the Zotarolimus-Eluting Peripheral Stent System

patient_data.ipd_description: The ZEN study was only a feasibility study with 30 subjects enrolled to see if therapy for this indication was viable. Although the preliminary data showed slight applicability/effectiveness, and no safety concerns, from a business standpoint, Medtronic chose not to pursue a pivotal trial and submit a PMA.
